Home → Mental health & wellbeing information service → Cancer: recommended titles

Cancer: recommended titles

Written by Sarah Lungley · Published Feb 20, 2015

Bladder cancer

  • 100 Questions & Answers About Bladder Cancer by Pamela Ellsworth and Brett Carswell
  • Living with a stoma by Craig White

Bone cancer

  • What’s up with Lyndon?: MediKidz explain osteosarcoma by Kim Chilman-Blair and John Taddeo

Bowel cancer

  • Bowel cancer: the essential guide by Ian Eustace

Brain cancer

  • Not the last goodbye by Dr David Servan-Schreiber
  • What’s up with Rachel?: MediKidz explain brain tumours by Kim Chilman-Blair and Shawn Deloache

Breast cancer

  • Breast cancer: the essential guide by Katherine Locke
  • [Breast reconstruction: your choice by Dick Rainsbury and Ginny Straker]hhttps://suffolk.spydus.co.uk/cgi-bin/spydus.exe/ENQ/OPAC/BIBENQ?BRN=486595)
  • Being Sarah: a true story about choice, control and breast cancer by Sarah Horton
  • Breast cancer by Emma Pennery, Val Speechley and Maxine Rosenfield
  • Getting it off my chest by Janice Day
  • The C-word by Lisa Lynch
  • What’s up with Bridget’s mum?: MediKidz explain breast cancer by Kim Chilman-Blair, John Taddeo and Shawn Deloache

Chemotherapy

  • Healthy eating with chemotherapy by Jose van Mil
  • Coping with chemotherapy by Terry Priestman
  • Your brain after chemo: a practical guide to lifting the fog and getting back your focus by Dan Silverman and Idelle Davidson

Leukemia

  • What’s up with Richard?: MediKidz explain leukaemia by Kim Chilman-Blair, John Taddeo and Shawn Deloache

Overcoming cancer

  • The Emperor of All Maladies: A Biography of Cancer by Siddhartha Mukherjee
  • Anni’s cancer companion: an A-Z of treatments, therapies and healing by Anni Matthews
  • The cancer survivor’s companion: practical ways to cope with your feelings after cancer by Dr Frances Goodhart and Lucy Atkins
  • How I said bah! to cancer: a guide to thinking, laughing, living and dancing your way through by Stephanie Butland
  • C: because cowards get cancer too by John Diamond
  • The selfish pig’s guide to caring by Hugh Marriott
  • Mum has cancer by Eileen Wheeler

Prostate cancer

  • 100 questions and answers about prostate cancer by Pamela Ellsworth
  • Coping successfully with prostate cancer by Tom Smith
  • Prostate cancer by Jane Plant
  • Prostate cancer: the essential guide by David Loshak

Skin cancer

  • Skin cancer and sun safety by Rachel Newcombe
  • What’s up with Tiffany’s dad?: MediKidz explain melanoma by Kim Chilman-Blair and Shawn Deloache

Sarah Lungley

I'm the mental health and wellbeing coordinator at Suffolk Libraries.
